Comment:
Hello everyone, I thought i would share this game because I've never seen this response to the opening played so I thought you wouldn't have either! (sorry if you have, i'm not that old a chess player that is why I wouldn't have seen it I guess:))

e4.
3. c3 - The ponziani opening (the opening I usually play.)
3. c3 - The ponziani opening (the opening I usually play.)
3. c3 - The ponziani opening (the opening I usually play.)
3. c3 - The ponziani opening (the opening I usually play.)
3. ...f5! - I've never seen this before but I definatly find it an attacking approach against the ponziani.
4. d4 - a typical ponziani move.
5. Bc4 - Ignoring the fact I can take blacks pawn.
5. Bc4 - Ignoring the fact I can take blacks pawn.
5. ... Nf6 - A natural developing move.
6. e5! - putting pressure on blacks knight.
6. ...d5?! - counter threatening whites bishop but after black eventually moves their knight they can't defend the d4 pawn.
7. ... Ne4 - moving the knight of trouble but white may start attacking towards blacks queen side through Nxd4
7. ... Ne4 - moving the knight of trouble but white may start attacking towards blacks queen side through Nxd4
9. e6! - threatening to win the black bishop so he has to move it really but after that NxN at least wins the Knight.
9. e6! - threatening to win the black bishop so he has to move it really but after that NxN at least wins the Knight.
9. e6! - threatening to win the black bishop so he has to move it really but after that NxN at least wins the Knight.
9. ... Nxd4!? - Leaving the black squared bishop threatened by a pawn and a piece (the pawn and bishop) with check so black will lose a piece and control of blacks defense.
11. Qxd4 - winning the knight and central control.
11. Qxd4 - winning the knight and central control.
11. Qxd4 - winning the knight and central control.
11. ... c6? - there isn't much black can do at this stage but i'm sure black could have tried to strengthen their defences with something like 11. ... h6.
12. f3! - forcing blacks knight of the square which protects Bg5+! so there isn't much black can do.
12. ...Nd6?? - a surpirsing move leaving a mate in one on, although there isn't much places the knight could have moved for example if 12. Nf6?? 13.Qc5 would be checkmate aswell.
So this variation didn't go down too well in this game but i'm sure it would be fine in some other cases :)
